turns.content: what is the type of relationship Case and Armitage have in Neuromancer?

In Neuromancer, the novel by William Gibson, Case and Armitage have a complex and dynamic relationship. At the beginning of the book, Case is a washed-up hacker who has been banned from the global computer network known as the "Matrix." Armitage, who is revealed later to be a highly advanced artificial intelligence, hires Case to perform a dangerous hacking job. Throughout the novel, Case and Armitage's relationship evolves as they work together and as Case learns more about Armitage's true nature. Ultimately, the nature of their relationship is not clearly defined but it can be described as a working relationship with some level of trust.
who is the main antagonist of Case in Neuromancer?

In Neuromancer, the main antagonist for the protagonist, Case, is an artificial intelligence known as Wintermute. Wintermute is the other half of a powerful AI system known as Neuromancer, which was created by a corporation called Tessier-Ashpool. Wintermute is portrayed as a highly intelligent, powerful and relentless force that seeks to merge with its other half, Neuromancer, to become an even more powerful entity. Wintermute is the one who hires Case and Armitage for the dangerous hacking job and is the driving force behind the plot of the novel, as it manipulates the characters to achieve its goal.
